column4: you have w32codecs? i think i played one using mplayer no problem a while ago
youre in gnome by default.  when you login thats what loads its your desktop environment
and for example the latest release is 2.16 so how do i install it?
im not sure if its distributed with distro specific packages  or not. if so id be pretty straight forward
its just a DE though.. i mean as long as you have windows displaying and the tools why bother
http://art.gnome.org/ or gnomelook website there is a good faq on onthe art.gnome.org website basically you just uppack the theme to like /usr/share/themes/
if you ls /usr/share/themes  all your current themes should show up
http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/29001499/  .. download this theme and see if this works for you
i dont have a gui right now im ssh'd into from work.  it does appear to be a valid gtk2 theme though
if you download then tar xfvz black.tar.gz  then sudo mv whateverdirectory /usr/share/themes/  then reopen your theme manager it doesnt work?
it should just be there then
ah
any solution?
might see if someone else here can download it and look. i can get away with a terminal open but vnc from work my boss might notice :)

im not too familiar with gnome. dont use it. but i think youre expecting the theme to make changes that would be from another theme. like application theme window border icon login manager theyre all diff things
might try http://sourceforge.net/projects/btmgr/ for a quick fix also
assuming you have a floppy drive
no need to mount but yes you can do like:   grub> root(hd1,0)   <-- this is the partition with ubuntu installed then setup(hd0)  or hd1 whichever hd is setup to boot in your systems bios
the recover howto gives a better explanation of that
in other words you can install grub to whatever hard driver mbr you wish regardless of which driver ubuntu is on
to repair windows mbr (dont do it! stick with linux) boot to windows or from windows boot disk type "fdisk /mbr" i think is right
